intro: Clidemia lacera, commonly known as the silverleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters, often in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and covered with a fine, silvery pubescence. Clidemia lacera thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
